column5: Anglers Kingdom on Nungesser lake. remote like a fly-in with out the expense of flying. great walleye fishing and trophy pike kg
I SEE 3 lodges on the lake,and how many outposts ? Thats alot of fishermen on a 25 mile lake

Nungesser lake has about 28,000 acres of water. It is a dark water lake with a huge forage base of ciscoes, whitefish and perch. I have fished hundreds of lakes across Canada and haven't found a more productive walleye lake whether fly-in or drive-in.
I recommend Birch Island Resort at Minaki. It is on the same water as Rough Rock. Definitely a great place. Don

Without question you need to try big North Lodge in Minaki. We have fished there for 5 years and although we are trying someplace new this year,if I was going to fish a couple hours from Winnipeg,we would be back to Big North in a heartbeat.Check out the website

Newby to the forum...Trying to book a trip for early June. Looking for a guided trip with Smallmouth, Pike and Walleye -- numbers are more important than trophies. Have narrowed it down to Carribou Falls, Rough Rock, and Separation Lake.Any guidance on these three lodges would be appreciated -- pros and/or cons. Other lodge recommendations in the area appreciated as well.Thanks!
Should have mentioned -- need to stay within a few hours drive of Winnepeg.

A few hours from winnipeg, man, come fish lake of the woods and rainy river, or even the north arm of rainy lake. Trophies and numbers in all three. And tons of great resorts.totem lodge on Lake of the woodscamps narrows on the north arm of rainy lakeno resort needed to fish rainy river, just stay in a hotel in emo
Just booked a trip this morning to Camp Narrows ( Rainy Lake) for a one week stay. It will take me 6 hours to get there... I'm a few minutes west of Winnipeg.
Check out www.witchbay.com About 3 hours from Winnipeg on LOTW.

Try Halley's camps on the English River (Umfreville Lake) just above Caribou Falls. You will catch numbers and trophy fish. They have three camps on the lake, one drive in housekeeping and two boat in (or fly in) that are full plan meals and all. We have been staying at their Caribou Falls camp for the past 12 years and they are fine folks. Paulhttp://www.halleyscamps.com/
When are you heading there? <Maybee I'll see you there, lol
I'm interested in that area for fall crappies, please give us a report when you get back, thanks! Bill
Shall do. Heading there for the 3rd week in July.
4.5 hours drive from Winnipeg. Endless Walleyes, Smallies, Pike, Lake Trout and Muskies.www.lacseulguide.com Spots in June are getting full everywhere......
